Fedora 39 - Logitech K400+
Very happy to report that this supports all of the options I've used which were typically only available by using Logitech's official "Logitech Options" software (only available for Windows). Personally, I like to permanently swap FX function keys, disable tap-to-click, and disable pinch-to-zoom on the touch pad. All of these options work well with Solaar on my K400+ and this software also appears to have a couple of bonus features that I don't remember seeing available through Logitech Options.
Something else that may come in handy for anyone reading this: If all you want to do is disable tap-to-click, then the K400 supports doing so without any software by simply pressing FN + Left Mouse button below the touchpad. To revert, just press FN + Left Mouse again.
summary: Functionally replaces Logitech Options on linux!
